SUMMARY #

MDMA

Drug Testing

by Erowid

SUMMARY #

U.S. DRUG TESTING SUMMARY MDMA Tested for in Standard Drug Tests ? NO Tested for in Extended Drug Tests ? YES Possible to Test for? YES Will Trigger Tests for Other Substances? Possible : Amphetamine Detection Period in Urine 1-3 days (single use) Detection Period in Urine 3-5 days (heavy use)

TEST TYPES #

Urine Testing


                    Context: 
                    This chunk provides specific information on MDMA drug testing, including detection methods, detection periods, false positive causes, and testing types, situating it within the larger context of Erowid's drug and chemical information resources.

metadata.title: Erowid MDMA Vault : Drug Testing
metadata.description: Information about amphetamines and methamphetamine in drug tests.

content:
Drug: MDMA | cid: 1615
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about amphetamines and methamphetamine in drug tests.
Erowid name: mdma
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Testing

                    Text: 
                    TEST TYPES #

Urine Testing

Though MDMA is not specifically tested for in the standard 'SAMHSA-5" drug tests, it is chemically closely enough related to amphetamines that recent MDMA users will test positive in both amphetamines (a common test) and methamphetamines (a somewhat newer and less common test). Because of this, the detection periods for MDMA are very similar to those for amphetamines. Also, many tablets of street ecstasy are not pure MDMA and frequently includes amphetamines (and may also contain DXM, caffeine, MDA, MDE, ephedrine etc) which may trigger drug tests. The U.S. Department of Transportation (US DOT) added MDMA, MDA, and MDE to their amphetamine portion of their "5 panel" test. See DOT Drug Testing: On and After Oct 1, 2010 - Still a 5 Panel. Amphetamines are standardly detectable in urine for 24-96 hours after use (72 average). Methamphetamines stay in the system slightly longer, 24-120 hours.

Hair Testing


                    Context: 
                    This chunk provides detailed information on drug testing methods for MDMA, including urinalysis and hair tests, detection periods, and substances that may cause false positives, relevant for understanding MDMA detection in toxicology reports within the broader context of drug information.

metadata.title: Erowid MDMA Vault : Drug Testing
metadata.description: Information about amphetamines and methamphetamine in drug tests.

content:
Drug: MDMA | cid: 1615
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about amphetamines and methamphetamine in drug tests.
Erowid name: mdma
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Testing

                    Text: 
                    Hair Testing

MDMA is detectable with hair tests and there are at least two drug testing companies (Psychemedics and Quest Diagnostics) which include it in their standard hair test. Hair tests generally take the most recent 1.5 inches of growth and use those for testing. That provides a detection period of approximately 90 days. If an individual's hair is shorter than 1.5 inches, this detection period will be shorter.

FALSE POSITIVES #

Substances or Conditions which can cause false positives


                    Context: 
                    This section discusses hair testing as a method for detecting MDMA use, noting that it can reveal drug intake over approximately 90 days using the most recent 1.5 inches of hair. It highlights laboratories like Psychemedics and Quest Diagnostics that include MDMA in their standard hair tests and warns of potential false positives caused by certain substances or conditions. This information is vital for understanding drug testing detection windows and false positive risks related to MDMA.

metadata.title: Erowid MDMA Vault : Drug Testing
metadata.description: Information about amphetamines and methamphetamine in drug tests.

content:
Drug: MDMA | cid: 1615
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about amphetamines and methamphetamine in drug tests.
Erowid name: mdma
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Testing

                    Text: 
                    FALSE POSITIVES #

Substances or Conditions which can cause false positives

Ephedrine, pseudoephedrine, propylephedrine, phenylephrine, or desoxyephedrine (Nyquil, Contact, Sudafed, Allerest, Tavist-D, Dimetapp, etc) Phenegan-D, Robitussin Cold and Flu, Vicks Nyquil Over-the-counter diet aids with phenylpropanolamine (Dexatrim, Accutrim) Over-the-counter nasal sprays (Vicks inhaler, Afrin) Asthma medications (Marax, Bronkaid tablets, Primatine Tablets) Prescription medications (Amfepramone, Cathne, Etafediabe, Morazone, ...phendimetrazine, phenmetrazine, benzphetamine, fenfluramine, dexfenfluramine, ...dexdenfluramine,Redux, mephentermine, Mesocarb, methoxyphenamine, phentermine, ... amineptine, Pholedrine, hydroymethamphetamine, Dexedrine, amifepramone, clobenzorex, ...fenproyorex, mefenorex, fenelylline, Didrex, dextroamphetamine, methphenidate, Ritalin, ...pemoline, Cylert, selegiline, Deprenyl, Eldepryl, Famprofazone) Kidney infection, kidney disease Liver disease, diabetes


                    Context: 
                    This section details substances and conditions that can cause false positive results in drug testing, particularly for substances like ephedrine, pseudoephedrine, and various medications and health issues. It is relevant within the comprehensive drug testing overview provided by the document, highlighting potential sources of incorrect positive results in urine and hair tests for MDMA and related substances.

metadata.title: Erowid MDMA Vault : Drug Testing
metadata.description: Information about amphetamines and methamphetamine in drug tests.

content:
Drug: MDMA | cid: 1615
Source: erowid | Source description: Information about amphetamines and methamphetamine in drug tests.
Erowid name: mdma
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Testing

                    Text: 
                    CAUTION & DISCLAIMER #

Erowid's drug testing information is a summary of data gathered from site visitors, journal articles, websites, and other resources. Detection periods depend on amount and frequency of use, metabolic rate, body mass, age, overall health, drug tolerance, and urine pH of each individual. Many substances that are not tested for in basic or extended urinalysis tests CAN be tested for by a laboratory willing to go to the trouble, although that is uncommon.

RELATED RESOURCES #

RELATED LINKS #

                    Context: 
                    This chunk provides the CAUTION & DISCLAIMER section of Erowid's drug testing information, explaining the limitations and variables affecting detection periods, and highlighting the potential for certain substances to cause false positives. Its placement within the full document emphasizes the importance of understanding testing accuracy and resource references related to ecstasy and drug test procedures.
